page.title: 09Clubs
page.content: After the first World War an Army hut was bought and erected at the west end of the village. There S.W.R.I. and Social Club meetings were held as were dances, whist drives etc. In 1963 a new Community Hall was built as part of Keig Primary School. The community contributed Â£1570 towards the fabric and furnishing of the hall. In this hall meetings of the S.W.R.I. are now held. A very successful Bowling Club meets there on 3 nights each week during autumn and winter. The Church Women's Guild meeets in the Church Hall on the 4th. Thursday of each month. A thriving football club plays on a pitch at the enterance to the grounds of Castle Forbes, the use of the land was donated by the late Atholl, Lord Forbes.
